intro: Kedrostis capensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces yellow flowers and has a distinctive, branched stem with spiny nodes. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can be quite large. Kedrostis capensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
